intro: Ruellia maderensis, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It prefers well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, making it a versatile choice for gardens and landscapes. Ruellia maderensis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
